source.title: How Clerk works
source.description: Clerk architecture covering Frontend API (FAPI), Backend API (BAPI), abstraction levels (prebuilt components, Elements, custom flows), hybrid authentication model with client and session tokens, token refresh mechanism, and handshake flow.

source.title: Clerk: Core concepts
source.description: Integration options including Account Portal, prebuilt components, and custom API flows; Dashboard configuration; session tokens and JWT authentication; key SDK objects including Clerk, Client, Session, User, Organization, SignIn, and SignUp.

source.title: SDK Reference: Clerk Next.js SDK
source.description: Clerk Next.js SDK overview: clerkMiddleware integration, client-side React hooks for authentication, organizations, and billing, server-side helpers for App and Pages routers, clerkClient backend API, and Auth object structure.

source.title: Next.js Quickstart (App Router)
source.description: Next.js App Router quickstart covering @clerk/nextjs installation, clerkMiddleware setup, ClerkProvider configuration, prebuilt authentication components including SignInButton, SignUpButton, SignedIn, SignedOut, and UserButton for user management.

source.title: Development: Clerk environment variables
source.description: Environment variables reference covering sign-in and sign-up redirect URLs, publishable and secret keys, API and SDK configuration, satellite domains, webhook signing secrets, telemetry settings, and deprecated variables with Next.js variants.

source.title: Development: Install Clerk with shadcn/ui CLI
source.description: Using shadcn/ui CLI to bootstrap Next.js apps with Clerk; quickstart package for complete setup, individual sign-in, sign-up, and waitlist pages, ClerkProvider component, and middleware installation commands.

source.title: Authentication flows: Sign-up and sign-in options
source.description: Authentication configuration options including email verification codes/links, phone/SMS with country allowlists, usernames, passwords, passkeys with domain restrictions, SSO connections, Web3 wallets, multi-factor authentication strategies, and user access restrictions.

source.title: Authentication flows: Customize your redirect URLs
source.description: Redirect URL customisation via environment variables (CLERK_SIGN_IN_URL, CLERK_SIGN_UP_URL, FORCE_REDIRECT_URL, FALLBACK_REDIRECT_URL) and component props (fallbackRedirectUrl, forceRedirectUrl, signInFallbackRedirectUrl) for controlling post-authentication navigation.

source.title: Securing your app: Legal compliance
source.description: Legal compliance settings requiring users to accept terms of service or privacy policy before sign-up, with dashboard configuration for express consent to legal documents.

source.title: Session management: Session tokens
source.description: Session token JWT structure and default claims (azp, exp, fva, iat, iss, sid, sub), organisation claims with feature-permission bitmask encoding, actor claims for impersonation, 4KB cookie size limits, and validation.

source.title: User management: Users
source.description: User object structure with identifiers and metadata, managing users via Dashboard or programmatically, frontend components (UserButton, UserProfile) and hooks, backend SDK methods including createUser() and deleteUser().

source.title: Read session and user data in your Next.js app with Clerk
source.description: Server-side helpers: auth(), currentUser() for App Router; getAuth(), clerkClient(), buildClerkProps() for Pages Router. Client-side useAuth() and useUser() hooks for session state, user data, and route protection.

source.title: Component Reference
source.description: Component reference covering authentication (SignIn, SignUp), user (UserButton, UserAvatar), organisation (OrganizationSwitcher), billing (PricingTable), control components (SignedIn, SignedOut, Protect, ClerkLoaded), unstyled buttons, and appearance customisation.

source.title: <SignIn /> component
source.description: SignIn component reference for Next.js including usage example, configuration properties for redirects, routing, OAuth flow, appearance customisation, initial values, transferable sign-ins, waitlist integration, and sign-up flow options.

source.title: <SignUp /> component
source.description: SignUp component for rendering user registration UI, including properties for appearance customisation, redirect URLs, OAuth flow options, routing strategies, initial values prefilling, and unsafe metadata handling.

source.title: <GoogleOneTap /> component
source.description: GoogleOneTap component for single-button Google sign-in and sign-up, covering setup requirements, usage example, configuration properties including redirect URLs, ITP and FedCM support, and known limitations.

source.title: <UserButton /> component
source.description: UserButton component rendering a user avatar dropdown menu with account management, sign-out functionality, multi-session account switching, appearance customisation, and navigation options for UserProfile integration.

source.title: <UserProfile /> component
source.description: UserProfile component for full-featured account management UI, including properties for appearance customisation, routing strategies, OAuth scopes, custom pages, fallback rendering, and navigation sidenav customisation options.

source.title: <Protect>
source.description: <Protect> component for client-side and server-side content protection based on authentication status, roles, permissions, plans, features, conditional logic via the condition prop, and fallback rendering for unauthorised users.

source.title: Appearance prop
source.description: The appearance prop for styling Clerk components including prebuilt themes, layout customisation, variables, element targeting with CSS classes, Tailwind integration, CSS modules, inline styles, and cssLayerName for cascade control.

source.title: Themes
source.description: Prebuilt themes including dark, simple, shadcn, shadesOfPurple, and neobrutalism with installation, usage patterns for applying themes globally or per-component, stacking multiple themes, and customising with variables.

source.title: Variables prop
source.description: Variables property for theming Clerk components including colour settings (primary, danger, success, warning, neutral, foreground, background, input, border), typography (fontFamily, fontSize, fontWeight), borderRadius, spacing, and CSS variable equivalents.

source.title: Layout prop
source.description: Layout property for SignIn and SignUp components including animations, logo placement and URL, social button positioning and variants, optional fields visibility, terms/privacy/help page URLs, shimmer effects, and development warnings.

source.title: captcha prop
source.description: CAPTCHA widget customisation via the captcha appearance property with theme options (auto, light, dark), size variants (normal, flexible, compact), and language/locale settings using Cloudflare Turnstile.

source.title: Customizing Clerk: Account Portal overview
source.description: Account Portal overview including sign-in, sign-up, user profile, organisation profile, create organisation, waitlist pages, URL structure, redirect configuration, fallback redirects, disabling the portal, and linking to pages with redirect parameters.

source.title: Add custom items and links to the <UserButton /> component
source.description: Customising UserButton component with custom menu items using UserButton.Action for triggering actions, UserButton.Link for navigation, reordering default items like manageAccount and signOut, and conditionally rendering items based on permissions.

source.title: Add custom pages and links to the <UserProfile /> component
source.description: Customising UserProfile component sidenav with custom pages using UserButton.UserProfilePage or UserProfile.Page, custom links using UserProfileLink, required props label labelIcon url and children, and reordering default Account and Security routes.

source.title: Add custom pages and links to the <OrganizationProfile /> component
source.description: Adding custom pages and external links to OrganizationProfile component sidenav, using OrganizationSwitcher.OrganizationProfilePage and OrganizationProfileLink components, with props for label, icon, URL, and reordering default routes.

source.title: Build your own sign-in-or-up page for your Next.js app with Clerk
source.description: Building unified sign-in-or-up pages using SignIn component with Next.js catch-all routes, configuring clerkMiddleware and createRouteMatcher for public routes, setting redirect URL environment variables.

source.title: Build your own sign-up page for your Next.js app with Clerk
source.description: Custom sign-up page setup in Next.js using the SignUp component with catch-all routing, clerkMiddleware route protection with createRouteMatcher, and environment variables for sign-up and redirect URLs.

source.title: Customizing Clerk: shadcn/ui
source.description: Complete sign-up and sign-in flow examples using Clerk Elements with shadcn/ui components, social OAuth connections, OTP verification input with custom render, loading states, and multi-step authentication.

source.title: Development: Testing
source.description: Testing strategies including fake OTP emails/phones, session token creation via Backend API, token refresh workflows, Testing Tokens for bypassing bot detection, and Playwright/Cypress integration support.

source.title: Development: Test emails and phones
source.description: Simulating OTP verification for E2E tests using +clerk_test email subaddresses, fictional 555 phone numbers, fixed code 424242, development instance monthly limits, and sign-in/sign-up code examples.

source.title: Development: Testing with Playwright
source.description: Playwright end-to-end testing integration with Clerk using @clerk/testing package, clerkSetup() for global configuration, setupClerkTestingToken() for bypassing bot detection, Testing Tokens, API key configuration, and authenticated test setup.

source.title: Customizing Clerk: Localization prop (experimental)
source.description: Localising Clerk components via ClerkProvider's localization prop, using @clerk/localizations for predefined translations, creating custom localisations for branding, finding localisation keys, contributing new languages, and customising error messages with unstable__errors.

source.title: <ClerkProvider>
source.description: ClerkProvider component reference covering session and user context, redirect URLs, appearance, localization, satellite apps, security validation (allowed origins, CSP nonce), telemetry, and SDK-specific properties for Next.js and Chrome Extension.

source.title: SDK Reference: User object
source.description: JavaScript User object with properties for identifiers, emails, phones, external accounts, passkeys, Web3 wallets, metadata, and organisation memberships. Methods for creating identifiers, managing passwords, TOTP, backup codes, and profile updates.
